sen.j: 大中臣氏（おおなかとみし）は日本古代の中央政権において祭祀をつかさどった貴族。
sen.e: The Onakatomi clan was a noble family who performed religious services at the central government in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: 古代日本→ancient Japan (出典： ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110000376445/en 等）
sen.e: The Onakatomi clan was a noble family who performed religious services at the central government in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Onakatomi clan was a noble family that led religious services at the central government in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 藤原鎌足が藤原姓を賜った後、その子藤原不比等が幼かったため、鎌足の甥で婿養子とも言われる中臣意美麻呂が暫定的に藤原氏を継いだ。
sen.e: NAKATOMI no Omimaro, who is said to be the nephew of FUJIWARA no Kamatari and who is also said to have been adopted as the husband for a daughter of FUJIWARA no Kamatari, succeeded the FUJIWARA clan temporarily as FUJIWARA no Fuhito, the son of Kamatari, was young after the family name of FUJIWARA was conferred upon Kamatari.
sen.cmt: 藤原姓→the family name of Fujiwara (出典：Fujiwara Kamatari Biography http://www.bookrags.com/biography/fujiwara-kamatari/)
sen.e: NAKATOMI no Omimaro, who is said to be the nephew of FUJIWARA no Kamatari and who is also said to have been adopted as the husband for a daughter of FUJIWARA no Kamatari, succeeded the FUJIWARA clan temporarily as FUJIWARA no Fuhito, the son of Kamatari, was young after the family name of FUJIWARA was conferred upon Kamatari.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After FUJIWARA no Kamatari was granted the kabane (hereditary title) Fujiwara, his son FUJIWARA no Fuhito was still young and therefore Kamatari's nephew, who is also said to have been his son-in-law, NAKATOMI no Omimaro temporarily inherited the kabane Fujiwara.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。クォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 後に、不比等の成長を待ち、正式に文武天皇の命令によって改めて鎌足の嫡男として不比等とその子孫のみに藤原姓を許し、他の者は中臣氏に復するように命じられて意美麻呂も中臣姓に戻る。
sen.e: Later, when Fuhito was grown, the family name of FUJIWARA was allowed only for Fuhito and his descendants according to an official order of Emperor Monmu, and others were told to return to the original family name of the Nakatomi clan; therefore, Omimaro also got back to his original family name of Nakatomi.
sen.cmt: 文武天皇→Emperor Monmu (マイページにはEmperor Mommu, Emperor Monmu, thte Emperor Monmu の３とおりの記載がみられました。「翻訳上の注意点」に従い、Emperor Monmuと記載しました。）
sen.e: Later, when Fuhito was grown, the family name of FUJIWARA was allowed only for Fuhito and his descendants according to an official order from Emperor Monmu, and others were told to use their original family name of Nakatomi so, Omimaro also went back to using his original family name of Nakatomi.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Later, when Fuhito had grown up, an order by Emperor Monmu stated that the kabane of Fujiwara was permitted only to be inherited by the descendants of Kamatari's heir Fuhito while the kabane of others were to be reverted to Nakatomi, and Omimaro returned to using the Nakatomi kabane.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。クォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 意美麻呂は不比等の後押しで中納言に昇進した。
sen.e: Omimaro was promoted to become Chunagon (Middle Counselor) owing to the support by Fuhito.
Omimaro was promoted to Chunagon (Middle Counselor) owing to the support of Fuhito.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Omimaro was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) with to the support of Fuhito and others.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 以後は中臣氏でも意美麻呂の子孫の家系を特に大中臣氏と称するようになる。
sen.e: Thereafter, among all the Nakatomi clan families, the family line of Omimaro and his descendants began to be called the Onakatomi clan.
Thereafter, amongst all the Nakatomi clan families in the family line of Omimaro and his descendants began to be called the Onakatomi clan.
sen.cmt: revised for clarity
sen.e: From then on, the Nakatomi clan descendants of the Omimaro came to be called the Onakatomi clan.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 大中臣氏の中で最も力を振るったのは意美麻呂の息子である大中臣清麻呂（位階・右大臣）（702年～788年）の系統で、神祇官や伊勢祭主を世襲した。
sen.e: The family line of ONAKATOMI no Kiyomaro (702-788), who was a son of Omimaro and whose Ikai (Court rank) was the minister of the right, exercised the power most diligently among the Onakatomi clan families, and they assumed such roles as Jingikan (Department of Shinto) and Ise Saishu (chief mourner of Ise-jingu Shrine), etc., by heredity.
sen.cmt: 神祇官→Jingikan (Department of Shinto) 出典：http://www.albany.edu/eas/205/rank%20chart.htm)
sen.e: The family line of ONAKATOMI no Kiyomaro (702-788), who was the son of Omimaro and whose Ikai (Court rank) was the minister of the right, exercised the power most diligently among the Onakatomi clan families, and they assumed such roles as Jingikan (Department of Shinto) and Ise Saishu (chief mourner of Ise-jingu Shrine), etc., by heredity.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Among the Onakatomi clan, the family line that wielded the most power was that descending from Omimaro's son ONAKATOMI no Kiyomaro (held the court rank of Minister of the Right) (702 - 788), and they inherited the positions of Jingikan (Department of Worship) and Ise Saishu (head priest of Ise-jingu Shrine).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 平安時代の大中臣能宣とその子大中臣輔親その孫伊勢大輔は歌人としても事績を残している。
sen.e: In the Heian period, ONAKATOMI no Yoshinobu, his son ONAKATOMI no Sukechika, and the grandson Ise no Taifu left great achievements as kajin (waka poets) as well.
In the Heian period, ONAKATOMI no Yoshinobu, his son ONAKATOMI no Sukechika, and the grandson Ise no Taifu left great achievements as kajin (waka poets) as well.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: During the Heian period, ONAKATOMI no Yoshinobu, his son ONAKATOMI no Sukechika, and his granddaughter Ise no Taifu also achieved prominence as kajin (waka poets).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: 平安時代中期以降白川家が神祇官を世襲するようになると、伊勢祭主及び神祇官を世襲するようになる。
sen.e: In the middle Heian period and later, when the Shirakawa family began to be responsible for Jingikan by heredity, the family line of ONAKATOMI no Kiyomaro became hereditary Ise Saishu and Jingikan.
sen.cmt: Original 「伊勢祭主及び神祇官を世襲するようになる」の主語を、ここ以前の文脈から「大中臣清麻呂の系統」と訳出しました。
sen.e: In the middle Heian period and later, when the Shirakawa family began to be responsible for Jingikan by heredity, the family line of ONAKATOMI no Kiyomaro became hereditary Ise Saishu and Jingikan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: When the Shirakawa family came to inherit the position of Jingikan in the mid-Heian period the descendants of ONAKATOMI no Kiyomaro came to inherit the positions of Jingikan and Ise Saishu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 子孫は江戸時代に藤波家を称するようになる。
sen.e: The descendants began to be called the Fujinami family in the Edo period.
The descendants called the Fujinami family during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: These descendants came to be known as the Fujinami family during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
